titles.title: Mäṣḥafä bǝrhan “Book of Light” / Tǝmhǝrtä haymanot “Teaching of the Faith” / Haymanotu lä-Yaʿqob ʾƎlbäradi “The Faith of Jacob Baradeus” / Mäṣḥafä bäqwǝʿet ʾǝm-dǝrsanä bahlu lä-qǝddus ʾabba Wägris “Book of Sufficiency from the Treatise of Sayings of Saint ʾAbba Evagrius” / Mǝʿdan bä-ʾǝntä sammǝntu ḫǝllinat zä-ʾabba Wägris “Treatise on the Eight Thoughts (of Evilness) by ʾAbba Evagrius” / Excerpt from the Collectio Monastica / Miscellaneous prayers and hymns

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä bǝrhan “Book of Light” (different from Mäṣḥafä bǝrhan “Book of Light” attributed to King Zärʾa Yaʿqob) (fols. 5ra-24rb l.2) II) Tǝmhǝrtä haymanot “Teaching of the Faith” (fols. 24rb l.5-38ra), in Amharic and Gәʿәz III) Haymanotu lä-Yaʿqob ʾƎlbäradi “The Faith of Jacob Baradeus” (fols. 38rb-66vb) IV) Mäṣḥafä bäqwǝʿet ʾǝm-dǝrsanä bahlu lä-qǝddus ʾabba Wägris “Book of Sufficiency from the Treatise of Sayings of Saint ʾAbba Evagrius” (fols. 67ra-76vb l.1) V) Mǝʿdan bä-ʾǝntä sammǝntu ḫǝllinat zä-ʾabba Wägris “Treatise on the Eight Thoughts (of Evilness) by ʾAbba Evagrius” (fols. 76vb l.2-91va l.2) VI) Excerpt from the Collectio Monastica ch. 20, 143-145 (Nägärä ʾabäw zä-mänäkosat “Saying(s) of the Fathers of Monks”) (fols. 91va l.5-94vb) Miscellaneous prayers and hymns: VII) Mälkǝʾa ḥawaryat “Image of the Apostles” (fols. 95ra-104ra) VIII) Bä-sägid sǝbḥat lä-zǝkrä sǝmǝkä... “Through worshipping (is) glory to the memory of your name...” (fols. 104rb-110rb) IX) Mälkǝʾa śǝʿǝl “Image of the Icon” (fol. 111ra-111vb l.7) X) Bä-sägid sǝbḥat lä-mäʿaza sǝmǝkä... “In worship is glory to the odor of your name...” (fols. 111vb l.9-114va l.11) (cp. Mss. EMML nos. 1095, 1246, 1380 etc.) XI) Ḫaylǝki täʿawqä bä-märḫabä ʿaläm säfänä... “Your might is known, prevails in the wide world...” (fols. 114vb-115va) XII) Mälkǝʾa ʾEwosṭatewos “Image of ʾEwosṭatewos (fols. 115vb-116va l.10) XIII) Sälam-hymn to Mary (fols. 116va l.13-118rb l.9) XIV) ʾO-ʾǝgziʾǝyä ʾIyäsus Krǝstos ʿǝqäbänni... “Oh My Lord Jesus Christ, protect me...” (litanical prayer to Christ) (fols. 119ra-143ra) (S. GRÉBAUT, “La prière ‘ʿƎqäbänni’ ou les litanies du Christ”, Orientalia nuova ser., 4, 1935, 426-40) XV) ʾO-ʾǝgziʾǝyä ʾIyäsus Krǝstos wäldä ʾǝgziʾabǝḥer ḥǝyyaw bä-ʾǝntä Maryam wäladitǝkä rǝdʾanni... “Oh my Lord Jesus Christ Son of the living God for the sake of Mary your begetter, help me...” (litanical prayer to Christ) (fols. 143rb-151ra) (ChRep no. 370, cp. Mss. EMML nos. 1817, 2041, 2798 etc.) XVI) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 151rb-169rb)
Additiones 1-5.

donors.donor: The name of the donor has been erased on fols. 38va, 67ra, 94vb, 104ra. The name, Wäldä <...>, has been erased from all supplications formulas in Texts XIV and XV; on fols. 120rab and 121rb it has been replaced with the name of ʿAmdä ʾƎgziʾ.

txstates.txstate: The leather cover is torn off in the lower part of the spine area and in the lower part of the back board. The sewing has been repaired with recent threads. The parchment of fol. 4 is translucent. Some fols. are covered with dirt.

mslits.mslit: R. COWLEY, “A text in old Amharic”, Bulletin of the School of Oriental and African Studies 37-3 (1974), pp. 597-607.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: criss-cross, cross hatching, Maltese cross, corni-form, double circle, single line fillet, triple dot fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(3; s.l.: 1, stub after 4; 3, stub before 4/fols. 1r-4v) – I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – II(8/fols. 13r-20v) – III(8/fols. 21r-28v) – IV(8/fols. 29r-36v) – V(8/fols. 37r-44v) – VI(8/fols. 45r-52v) – VII(8/fols. 53r-60v) – VIII(8/fols. 61r-68v) – IX(8/fols. 69r-76v) – X(8; s.l.: 4, stub after 5; 5, stub after 4/fols. 77r-84v) – XI(8/fols. 85r-92v) – XII(8/fols. 93r-100v) – XIII(8/fols. 101r-108v) – XIV(2/fols. 109r-110v) – XV(8/fols. 111r-118v) – XVI(8/fols. 119r-126v) – XVII(8/fols. 127r-134v) – XVIII(8/fols. 135r-142v) – XIX(10/fols. 143r-152v) – XX(9; s.l.: 5, stub after 5/fols. 153r-161v) – XXI(8/fols. 162r-169v).

taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The upper line is written below the ruling on fols. 13r-20v.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: good and careful; hand b: good and careful.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 5ra-110rb, 115vb-119rb, broadly spaced slightly left sloping letters; Text XVI is written in smaller letters. Hand b: fols. 111ra-115va

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; first component of the name of the donor; names of the protagonists of Texts VII and XII; two or three lines (alternating with black lines) of the incipit of Texts I-III, VIII-XVI; two initial lines of the incipit of Texts IV-VII; two initial lines of the sections of Text II; supplication formula on fol. 118rb; word sälam “greeting” and its abbreviations in Texts VII, XII and XIII; phrases bä-sägid sǝbḥat “through worshipping (is) glory” and mäḥarit “merciful” in Text VIII; words lä-sǝʿǝlǝki “to your icon” and bä-ǝntä “for the sake of” in Text IX; parts of the body and a few other words in Text X; a few words in Text XI; a few words such as täfässǝḥi “rejoice”, ʾanti “you”, kwǝllomu “all of them”, tänäbäyu “they prophesied” in Text XVI; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals and/or their elements.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ስ፡/ስብ፡/ስብሐ፡ for ስብሐት፡ (e.g., fols. 107rb, 107vb, 108rb, 108vab, 109ra) ሰ፡/ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ (fols. 116rb, 117ra, 117vb) ሰአ፤ ቅ/ሰ፤ ለ፤ ቅ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት (fol. 151vb) ሰበ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ (fol. 151vb) ሠ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ (e.g., fols. 152rb, 153rab, 155va)

otherdetails.otherdetail:
Some details concerning the contents of the Ms.: - Incipit of Text IV: ʾAʾǝmǝr ʾo-ʾaḥaw fǝqur ʾǝsmä ʾafqǝrotä zatti ʿaläm tähawwǝk lǝbbä..., “Know, oh beloved brothers that the love of this world troubles the heart...”; cf. BritLib Orient 754, fols. 180b-181b (WrBriMus 220-222, no. 331, esp. 221; EMML no. 1387, fols. 84b-86b (EMML IV, 450-451, esp. 450). - Text V: cf. BritLib Orient 754, fols. 178a-180a (WrBriMus 220-222, no. 331, esp. 221); BritLib Orient 757, fol. 140a-142a (WrBriMus 223, no. 335; EMML no. 1387, fols. 81a-86b (EMML IV, 450-451, esp. 450) It contains the following parts: V-1) Bä-ʾǝntä sǝssu kärś “On Gluttony” (fols. 76vb l. 6-78vb l.6) V-2) Bä-ʾǝntä fǝqrä nǝway “On Avarice” (fols. 78vb l.6-80ra l.9) V-3) Bä-ʾǝntä sǝbḥat bǝṭul “On Vainglory” (fols. 80ra l.9-81va l.7) V-4) Bä-ʾǝntä tǝʿǝbit “On Pride” (fols. 81va l.7-83rb l.8) V-5) Bä-ʾǝntä zǝmut “On Fornication” (fols. 83rb l.8-86rb l.6) V-6) Bä-ʾǝntä mäʿat “On Anger” (fols. 86rb l.6-87vb l.10) V-7) Bä-ʾǝntä ḥǝmamä lǝbb “On Akedia and on Sadness” (fols. 87vb l.10-91rb l.1). - Text VI: cf. V. ARRAS, Collectio Monastica, Louvain 1963 (CSCO 238, 239 [SAe 45, 46]), ch. 20, 143-145. - Text XV: cf. EMML no. 1308, fols. 2b-4b (EMML IV, 322-323, esp. 322).
Text V contains an embedded colophon (fol. 91rb): በሰላም፡ ተተርጐመ፡ እምዓረቢ፡ ለግዕዝ:: በመዋዕለ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ገላውዴዎስ:: እምአመ፡ ነግሠ፡ በ፲ወ፫ዓመት፡ ስብሐት፡ ለእግዚአብሔር: ወትረ፡ እስከ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም: አሜን:: “It was translated in peace from Arabic into Gǝʿǝz; in the time of our King, the lover of God, Gälawdewos; in the 13th year of his reign, glory to God always until eternity, Amen.”

additional.cont: Fol. 1v-2r: Record concerning revenues from the land.
additional.det: The record is hardly legible due to faded ink. It is carefully written in a trained hand.

additional.cont: Fol. 3ra-b l.8: ˀAsmat-prayer concerning monthly bleeding (dämä maḫḍän).
additional.det: It is carefully written in the same hand as Additio 3. Some parts of it are hardly legible.

additional.cont: Fol. 3rb l.9: ˀAsmat-prayer against demons.
additional.det: It is carefully written in the same hand as Additio 2.

additional.cont: Fols. 110v, 118v: Excerpts from Wəddase Maryam zä-sänuy “Praise of Mary for Monday”.
additional.det: Written in a mediocre hand, in angular script.
It is written in Amharic, hardly legible.

extras.extra: - A note or an omitted passage of the text written in the upper margin of fol. 51vb. - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of a cross, indicating the place where the omission, written in the lower margin, belong: fol. 113ra l.9. - Corrections written over erasures: e.g., fols. 20va, 22vb, 24rb, 27ra, 29va, 31ra, 40vb, 43va, 55va, 60rb, 65vb, 82ra, 88ra, 98rb, 102rb, 104rab. - Omitted phrases, words and letters written interlineally: e.g., fols. 8rb, 9rb, 16ra, 17ra, 18va, 21ra, 27rb, 31ra, 32rb, 37ra, 51rb, 54ra, 59rab, 77rb, 78vb, 79va, 80vb, 88ra, 100rb, 129ra, 154va, 159rb. - Erasures marked with two or three parallel lines: fols. 68va, 103rb, 114vb. - Pen trials: fols. 1r, 110rb, 160va, 161va. - Minor notes, writing exercises, doodles: fols. 1r, 2v, 4rv, 169rb.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Threads are inserted in the margin of fols. 24r, 104r (green), 76v, 111r (white) and 91v (orange), marking the borders between the texts.
